results.description:
Overview

The Golful Golf series is a set of two golf games developed by Artdink for the PlayStation 2. Both games have a cartoon style similar to the Hot Shots Golf series.

The second game, Motto Golful Golf was released in European regions under the name Mr. Golf.
results.name: Golful Golf

results.description:
Overview

The Sylvio franchise is a series of first-person horror adventure games developed by Stroboskop.
results.name: Sylvio

results.description:
Overview

The NCIS franchise is a series of games based on the television series of the same name.
results.name: NCIS

results.description:
Overview

The Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku franchise is a series of Pachi-Slot simulation games developed and published by Aruze Corp. The series spans several platforms starting with PlayStation.

There is a sub-series called Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket that was exclusive to Neo Geo Pocket Color.
results.name: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku

results.description:
Overview

The Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket franchise is a series of Pachi-Slot simulation games developed and published by Aruze Corp. Unlike the main Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku series, this series is exclusive to the Neo Geo Pocket Color.
results.name: Pachi-Slot Aruze Ōkoku Pocket

results.description:
Overview

The Unitron franchise is a series of role-playing games developed by Yumekobo and published by SNK. Both games in the series were on the Neo Geo Pocket Color.

Only the first game, Biomotor Unitron was released outside of Japan.
results.name: Unitron

results.description:
Games included in this series (in order of release):

  • 10 Cent Classics: Bam 'N Jam - Re-release with new title screen.
  • 10 Cent Classics: Shady Pack - Two game compilation of Shady's Poopong: 22nd Anniversary Edition and a remaster of Shady's Stone Smash.
  • 10 Cent Classics: Chomperman - PC version is a re-release with the "10 Cent Classics" text added to the title screen. Mac version is aesthetically different but uses the same sprites and engine.
results.name: 10 Cent Classics

results.description:
Overview

The K-1 Pocker Grand Prix franchise is a series of kickboxing/martial arts games on the Game Boy Advance. This series is a GBA exclusive off shoot of the other K-1 games that Daft Co. developed.
results.name: K-1 Pocket Grand Prix

results.description: A tragic dramatic irony is that the PlayStation Mobile service shuttered seven months after the Appli Archives series began, thus rendering these preservation of inaccessible games inaccessible once more.
results.name: Appli Archives

results.description:
Overview

Japanese Rail Sim, originally known as Japanese Rail Sim 3D and known in Japan as Tetsudou Nippon! (which loosely translates to "Railway Japan!") is a series of Japanese train driving simulation games developed and released by Sonic Powered. They were released mostly on Nintendo's handheld platforms (the Nintendo 3DS and Nintendo Switch), with one game (Journey to Kyoto) later receiving a port for the PlayStation 4 and PC.

Similar to the Train Simulator series, the game uses real-life footage as full-motion video for the cab window, giving a realistic illusion of the train being driven. As with other FMV train simulators, the footage speeds up and slows down depending on the train's speed. The series features realistic reconstructions of the interior of each train cab, with the 3DS and Switch games featuring the use of touch controls.

As the name implies, the series focuses solely on railways throughout Japan. The original "Rosen Tabi" (or "Route Trip") series tended to focus on local lesser-used train lines, especially sightseeing lines in rural areas, while the later "Real Pro" series focused on more express routes. Some entries of the series focus on different types of trains, such as monorail trains and steam locomotives. Each entry features an unlockable travel guidebook to the areas encountered (and their surroundings) in an effort to boost tourism.

Gameplay-wise, each game in the series focuses on the same progression system, with players going through each section of the route (station-to-station) followed by an unlockable full route and free-form mode. Similar to other Japanese train simulation games, such as the Densha de Go! series, players follow the changing speed limit, the strict timetable, and the positioning of each platform stop, and are graded on their performance.

While most of the earlier games received localized ports for overseas release, most of the later entries remain exclusive to Japan.
results.name: Japanese Rail Sim 3D

results.description:
Overview

The Old & New franchise is a series of two games that were updated versions of classic Taito games. Bubble Bobble Old & New and Elevator Action Old & New both contain the original versions of the games as well as new updated versions of the games that include new art and gameplay elements.
results.name: Old & New

results.description:
Overview

The Demon Hunter franchise is a series of hidden object games that were developed by Brave Giant and published by Artifex Mundi.
results.name: Demon Hunter
